com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.sail

Class SailGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.sail.SailGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph, MetaGraph<org.openrdf.sail.Sail>, TransactionalGraph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LinkedDataSailGraph, MemoryStoreSailGraph, NativeStoreSailGraph, SparqlRepositorySailGraph

    public class SailGraph
extends Object
implements TransactionalGraph, MetaGraph<org.openrdf.sail.Sail>
    A Blueprints implementation of the RDF-based Sail interfaces by Aduna (http://openrdf.org).
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com), Joshua Shinavier (http://fortytwo.net)

        public Vertex addVertex(Object id)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Create a new vertex, add it to the graph, and return the newly created vertex. The provided object identifier is a recommendation for the identifier to use. It is not required that the implementation use this identifier.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getVertices

        public Iterable<Vertex> getVertices()
        Description copied from interface: Graph

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getVertices

        public Iterable<Vertex> getVertices(String key,
                           Object value)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph that have a particular key/value property. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown. The graph implementation should use indexing structures to make this efficient else a full vertex-filter scan is required.
        Specified by:
        getVertices in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        key - the key of vertex
        value - the value of the vertex
        Returns:
        an iterable of vertices with provided key and value

      • getEdges

        public Iterable<Edge> getEdges(String key,
                      Object value)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph that have a particular key/value property. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown. The graph implementation should use indexing structures to make this efficient else a full edge-filter scan is required.
        Specified by:
        getEdges in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the edge
        value - the value of the edge
        Returns:
        an iterable of edges with provided key and value

        public Edge addEdge(Object id,
           Vertex outVertex,
           Vertex inVertex,
           String label)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Add an edge to the graph. The added edges requires a recommended identifier, a tail vertex, an head vertex, and a label. Like adding a vertex, the provided object identifier may be ignored by the implementation.

        Parameters:
        id - the recommended object identifier
        outVertex - the vertex on the tail of the edge
        inVertex - the vertex on the head of the edge
        label - the label associated with the edge

      • addNamespace

        public void addNamespace(String prefix,
                String namespace)
        Add a prefix-to-namespace mapping to the Sail connection of this graph.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix (e.g. tg)
        namespace - the namespace (e.g. http://tinkerpop.com#)

      • loadRDF

        public void loadRDF(InputStream input,
           String baseURI,
           String format,
           String baseGraph)
        Load RDF data into the SailGraph. Supported formats include rdf-xml, n-triples, turtle, n3, trix, or trig. Before loading data, the current transaction is successfully committed.
        Parameters:
        input - the InputStream of RDF data
        baseURI - the baseURI for RDF data
        format - supported formats include rdf-xml, n-triples, turtle, n3, trix, or trig
        baseGraph - the baseGraph to insert the data into

      • saveRDF

        public void saveRDF(OutputStream output,
           String format)
        Save RDF data from the SailGraph. Supported formats include rdf-xml, n-triples, turtle, n3, trix, or trig.
        Parameters:
        output - the OutputStream to which to write RDF data
        format - supported formats include rdf-xml, n-triples, turtle, n3, trix, or trig

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • stopTransaction

        public void stopTransaction(TransactionalGraph.Conclusion conclusion)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph
        Stop the current transaction. Specify whether the transaction was successful or not. A failing transaction will rollback all updates to before the transaction was started.

        If there is currently no open transaction (i.e. no operations on the graph), then calling this method has no effect other than potentially re-initializing data structures.

        Specified by:
        stopTransaction in interface TransactionalGraph
        Parameters:
        conclusion - whether or not the current transaction was successful

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph
        Stop the current transaction and successfully apply mutations to the graph.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface TransactionalGraph

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph
        Stop the current transaction and drop any mutations applied since the last transaction.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface TransactionalGraph

        public String toString()
        Overrides:

      • getFeatures

        public Features getFeatures()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Get the particular features of the graph implementation. Not all graph implementations are identical nor perfectly implement the Blueprints API. The Features object returned contains meta-data about numerous potential divergences between implementations.
        Specified by:
        getFeatures in interface Graph
        Returns:
        the features of this particular Graph implementation

      • query

        public GraphQuery query()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Generate a query object that can be used to fine tune which edges/vertices are retrieved from the graph.
        Specified by:
        query in interface Graph
        Returns:
        a graph query object with methods for constraining which data is pulled from the underlying graph

      • executeSparql

        public List<Map<String,Vertex>> executeSparql(String sparqlQuery)
                                       throws RuntimeException
        Evaluate a SPARQL query against the SailGraph (http://www.w3.org/TR/rdf-sparql-query/). The result is a mapping between the ?-bindings and the bound URI, blank node, or literal represented as a Vertex.
        Parameters:
        sparqlQuery - the SPARQL query to evaluate
        Returns:
        the mapping between a ?-binding and the URI, blank node, or literal as a Vertex
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if an error occurs in the SPARQL query engine
